I suspect this is not a Modeling website bug ;)  Changing product to Web Tools, based on stack trace.
Bruce, in what version did you find this problem?

(In reply to comment #3)
> Bruce, in what version did you find this problem?
> 

3.2 and 3.2.1, from the callisto updater.

I noticed also that the problem doesn't happen if I rename a file from *.xml to *.XML, ie: upper case XML extension works fine.

-Bruce
Bruce, are you running with just WTP installed, or are there additional plugins (like XMLBuddy, for example) installed as well?

(In reply to comment #5)
> Bruce, are you running with just WTP installed, or are there additional plugins
> (like XMLBuddy, for example) installed as well?
> 

No XML buddy, I read that that might cause problems with WTP.

The only non callisto things I have are
p4swad (perforce)
PyDev
Lowagie iText
How did you open the XML file in the XML Schema Editor?

(In reply to comment #7)
> How did you open the XML file in the XML Schema Editor?
> 

Package explorer, double click on file, or rt click and open with XML Schema editor.

Hi Bruce, I can't reproduce this on the latest 153 driver.

Can you attach the .xsd file instead of the .xml file?

Anything special about the file, such as it being a linked file?

It's on an NFS mount.
In fact, what I've been doing is creating file.XSD as a link to file.xsd just so that I can use it. Opening the .XSD link is fine, whereas the .xsd file yields the NullPtr thing.
So, just to be clear, it's a link in the Eclipse resource sense, not in the 'nix "ln" command sense?

The link vs file in "ln -s" sense makes no difference.
The directory containing these files is a link to a filesystem in the eclipse sense also. It's under perforce control, if that matters, using the p4swad plugin.
